name: gloatingly
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
in a gloating way (= feeling pleasure because of your good luck or someone else's failure): His comedy is sharp but never gloatingly superior. The anchorwoman told viewers gloatingly that the footage was exclusive. See
gloat
More examplesFewer examples They gloatingly described how they had infiltrated every household in the land. "I thought you would be interested," he said, and he rubbed his hands together gloatingly. This should have become what the publishers gloatingly call 'a runaway best-seller'.
